column4: I am _not_ trolling, or starting a flame war, but did Ubuntu choose LibreOffice over OpenOffice because OpenOffice´s status was in question at the time Ubuntu made the decision>
no, because like most other distros *buntu used Go-OO before, and LO is the logical continuation of Go-OO, only w/o the trademark
Thanks.
It´s a nice day, isn´t it?
what gfx card?
I don't know.
lspci | grep -i vga
Is there a way to find out?
Mental telepathy...
gohdan: GeForce 6150 noforce 40] rev 2
sudo apt-get install nvidia-current && sudo nvidia-xconfig <- then reboot
Oh, for cut-and-paste in the terminal window... :-~
how about you finish your nVidia driver installation? ;)
I've installed nvidia-current; it couldn't find the other package, but nvidia-current pulled in some packages that seem to be appropriate.
I guess it's reboot time...
what other pkg?  nvidia-xconfig is not a pkg, it's a command that comes w/ the nVidia driver
Oh, I misunderstood.  I'll do the nvidia-xconfig.  Thanks for the heads up.
the xorg.conf looks _MUCH_ better than the 2-line one I had before.
reboot time. BRB.
What was that nvidia command again?
What was that nvidia command again?
